items.title: Earthquake faults may have played key role in shaping the culture of ancient Greece
items.summary: The Ancient Greeks may have built sacred sites deliberately on land affected by previous earthquake activity, according to a new study.

alternate.title: Earthquake faults may have played key role in shaping the culture of ancient Greece

items.title: AI -- Engineering: merging, morphing, mobile robots
items.summary: Researchers have developed self-reconfiguring modular robots that can merge, split and even self-heal while retaining full sensorimotor control. The work may take us closer to producing robots that can autonomously change their size, shape and function.

alternate.title: AI -- Engineering: merging, morphing, mobile robots

thumbnail.title: AI -- Engineering: merging, morphing, mobile robots

items.title: 'Keep it local' approach more effective than government schemes at protecting rainforest
items.summary: Conservation initiatives led by local and indigenous groups can be just as effective as schemes led by government, according to new research. In some cases in the Amazon rainforest, grassroots initiatives can be even more effective at protecting this vital ecosystem.

alternate.title: 'Keep it local' approach more effective than government schemes at protecting rainforest

items.title: Long sitting periods may be just as harmful as daily total
items.summary: A new study founds that sitting around for 12 or more hours per day, particularly if accumulated during 60- to 90-minute periods, increased the risk of early death -- even in those who exercised.

alternate.title: Long sitting periods may be just as harmful as daily total

items.title: Rising CO2 leading to changes in land plant photosynthesis
items.summary: Researchers have determined that major changes in plant behavior have occurred over the past 40 years, using measurements of subtle changes in the carbon dioxide (CO2) currently found in the atmosphere.

alternate.title: Rising CO2 leading to changes in land plant photosynthesis

items.title: Abdominal fat a key cancer driver for postmenopausal women
items.summary: Body fat distribution in the trunk is more important than body weight when it comes to cancer risk in postmenopausal women, according to a new study.

alternate.title: Abdominal fat a key cancer driver for postmenopausal women

items.title: Nurses' regular use of disinfectants is associated with developing COPD
items.summary: Regular use of disinfectants is linked to a higher risk of developing chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), according to new research looking at incidence of the disease in over 55,000 nurses in the USA.

alternate.title: Nurses' regular use of disinfectants is associated with developing COPD
